text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with deviled lobster tails that's
right you've always wanted to serve
lobster at that fancy dinner party not
working with live lobsters is very
intimidating and messy not to mention
you're the one killing the lobsters
which not everyone is into so for those
reasons and more I'm very excited to
show you how to work with lobster tails
which are way way easier and if you use
the following technique also gorgeous
and delicious so let's go ahead and get
started
and we're going to begin with the real
secret to this recipe the sauce which is
why we call it the secret sauce and for
that we're going to need a little bit of
mayonnaise to which we will add a pinch
of kosher salt and also apparently a
tiny piece of mystery herb and then
because we're calling this deviled we're
going to need some heat so I'm going to
add a nice squeeze of hot sauce that's
sriracha but you could use any kind of
wound
we will also hedge our bets with some
cayenne as well as a little touch of
paprika and by the way I'm going to need
you to pay attention and stop staring at
that grain of salt thank you and then
we're definitely to want a little touch
of acidity which I will accomplish with
a little bit of freshly squeezed lemon
and then last but not least we will
finish this off with some freshly
chopped tarragon or I guess if you want
some other mild sweet herbs things like
chervil or sorrel or even dill would be
very nice and then all we need to do is
grab a spoon and mix that together at
which point we can move on to the only
other component in this dish
our lobster tails and these right here
about 5 to 6 ounces each and the first
thing we're going to want to do here is
split these exactly in half which is not
as easy as it sounds because of that
tough slippery shell so because of that
we're going to use a very specialized
technique that involves two cuts so for
the first one what we'll do is take a
heavy knife or cleaver and we'll find
the center with the point of our knife
about halfway down the towel at which
point we will cut in splitting the
bottom in half and once our first cuts
done it's very easy to cut the rest of
the way through by turning it make you
sure we're centered and then just
finishing the cut okay so let's try that
one more time we will find the exact
center about halfway down and cut
through the tail and then we'll simply
turn it and then just finish that cut
through the thick part okay so a
relatively safe and easy method for
splitting those in half and then what
we'll do once those are cut is see if we
need to devein them
okay just like shrimp lobster tail do
have an intestinal tract that may need
to get pulled out which is what I'm
doing right here and then what we'll do
once our lobster tails are split into
veined is carefully peel that meat up
away from the shell just push your
fingertip between the meeting the shell
right where it starts and you'll see
that meat will pull up from the shell
fairly easily but we don't want to go
all the way because we're going to cook
it in the show so we'll leave it
attached to the Talon and we'll lay that
meat right back in where it was okay so
go slow be a little careful try not to
tear the meat so I went ahead loosened
up the lobster meat my four halves at
which point we can transfer those to
some kind of baking sheet which as
you'll notice I've lined with some
crinkled up foil and that's just to keep
those lobster tails in place because
that shells kind of slippery and then
what we'll do once those are placed down
is take our sauce and apply some under
and on top of the lobster so for each
one we will lift up that meat and spread
some sauce into the bottom of the shell
and then once we have our sauce under
the lobster meat
we will also apply a very generous
amount over the top and by the way while
I'm sauce in these it'd be a great time
to remind you that this is a technique
not necessarily a recipe okay as long as
the base of your sauce is Mayo you could
pretty much flavor this any way you want
I mean I don't want to go on some big
rant here but you are the christian bale
of your lobster tail so do not be afraid
to experiment with these seasonings oh
and speaking of angry rants make sure
you check out the blog post because I'm
going to go into one thing I hate the
grocery stores do when they sell lobster
tails and how to avoid it so be sure to
check that out but anyway once our
lobster tails have been successfully
sauced they are ready to finish in a
very hot oven or under the broiler which
is my preferred method so let's go ahead
and place those about eight inches under
a broiler set on high and we'll broil
those for about five to seven minutes or
until they are nicely browned and cooked
through and if everything's gone
according to plan they should hopefully
look something like this check it out
those do look good and for once we don't
have to let them rest so I immediately
went ahead and serve those up on some
cold shaved cucumbers and that's because
hot spicy and sweet always works
magnificently well with cold and bitter
and really other than a little piece of
lemon this is so gorgeous it does not
need any more garnishing plus I forgot
to save the top of a sprig of tarragon
but still the point is this is
absolutely stunning and I cannot wait to
turn to this and please do not let my
suspect for
knife skills fool you because we
separated that me from the shell this is
very very easy to eat but forget about
how user-friendly this is the taste and
texture are just absolutely amazing I
mean we have that beautiful sweet moist
tender lobster meat cloaked in just
enough of that spicy creamy sauce which
really if we think about it is two
sauces we have that sauce it was
caramelized on the top plus that sauce
we put in the shell that's now mingled
with all those juices to create
something so delicious it doesn't even
have a name which is why I've always
loved this technique but anyway that's
it what I'm calling deviled lobster
tails when you consider how delicious
beautiful and easy this is I'm really
not sure there's a better way to enjoy
lobster plus we didn't have to kill
anything which is nice so I really do
hope you give this a try soon head over
to food wishes comm for all the
ingredient amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
[Music]
